feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Why can other users not see the “Install” button for my published Data Product in SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
I have created a Data Product in SAP Datasphere and published it successfully. I can find it in the Marketplace, and other users can also see it listed. However, they do not see the blue Install button, even though they have the same roles and permissions as I do.

My Data Product looks like this when I open it from the Marketplace (see Image 1). As you can see, the Install button is missing.
The Install button normally looks like in Image 2, depending on the settings of the Data Provider.

What could be the reason for this? Are there additional steps required to make the Data Product installable for other users in the same Datasphere tenant?

Any guidance or best practices would be appreciated.

entry.title: SAC: Unable to open private Bookmark after story conversion
entry.content:
After migrating sac classic story to optimized design mode and try to open my saved bookmark, I get the following error message:

Something went wrong while enabling the following bookmark for optimized view mode: "name_of_the_bookmark". Please try refreshing the story, modifying the story and trying again, or contacting support.

I could found a sap note which adresses exactly this issue but the issue should be resolved as of release 2023.21.14:

3409867 - Users unable to open stories they created a book mark in after the story converted to optimized mode in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)

I shared the private Bookmark with my colleague and he was able to open it.

Could someone explain this behavior to me, please?

entry.title: Auto Top N sort order mismatch in SAC optimized story
entry.content:
Hello Community,

■Environment：
　SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Optimized Story Experience

■Problem / Phenomenon：
　Phenomenon: Automated Top N Sort Order Mismatch
　I am using the Optimized Story Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

　When a chart's dimension members exceed the visualization limit, the Automatic Top N filter is applied by the system as expected.

　However, the resulting sort order of this automatically applied Top N (e.g., Top 10) does not align with the sort order of a manually configured Descending Sort (on a bar chart) or a Manual Top N filter.


　In short, the automated Top N function appears to be using a sort criterion other than the core measure, leading to inconsistent results across charts.

■Details and Verification Results：
The analysis uses the following structure:

Dimension: [Dimension01] (114 unique members)
Measure: [measure01]


As shown in the attached image, the Automatic Top N result is inconsistent with the results from the Manual Top N and the Table Chart (All Data Sorted Descending by Measure01).


■Verification Steps:

Verification 1: The manual sort using Measure01 matches the "All Data" Table/Bar Chart result.

Verification 2: We confirmed that the Automatic Top N is NOT sorting based on our intended measure (Measure01).

Verification 3: We created a separate table to verify the Record Count (Count of Records) for each member, and the Automatic Top N is NOT sorting by Record Count either.

Verification 4: No Top N or Rank filter is visible in the Builder/Filter panel of the automatically restricted chart.

■Specific Question：

Given that the sort order does not match either Measure01 or the number of records, what criteria (what sort order) does the automatic Top N function in SAC's optimized stories use to perform the default sorting?

Is the system referencing a hidden default measure or an internal sort mechanism that is not accessible to the user? Knowing the criteria is essential for understanding the data presented.

If anyone knows about this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: How can I schedule the data transfer of Budget/Forecast from SAP Analytics Cloud to S/4HANA?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I would like to ask how I can schedule the transfer of Budget/Forecast data from SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to the S/4HANA system.

Specifically:

  • Is there a way to set up an automatic schedule to send the data at a specific time or after the completion of the data entry process?
  • Can this be done either via SAC’s schedule functionality or through some calendar event or trigger after finishing the data submission?
  • Are there any best practices or standard procedures to synchronize Budget/Forecast data between the two systems?

    Any information, guidance, or examples regarding availability and implementation steps would be greatly appreciated.

    Thank you in advance!

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud : unshared Story is still available through the link in the email
entry.content:
Hello,

I shared a story in SAP Analytics Cloud and, during the sharing process, I selected the option ' Email new recipients' ,  which included a link to the report. After I unshared the story, the user can no longer see it in SAC; however, they are still able to access the report via the link they received when the story was originally shared.

Do you have any suggestions on how to resolve this issue?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Export from SAC to ACDOCU table
entry.content:
I developed a data model in SAC that represents the dimensions and measures of the ACDOCU table used in Group Reporting.

In the "Modeler" area of the "Data Management" page, I am trying to export data to S/4HANA. I selected "Group Reporting Planning Integration" as the S/4HANA application. When I map the SAC dimensions to the S/4HANA fields and attempt to replace a value, the system displays the error shown "The items can't be loaded due to a technical error." (see Picture 1)

How can I resolve this error message in the system?

entry.content:

We're having a requirement where we would create a Model based on Success Factors customer OData Service API.

However after succesfully connecting and when reading the API we're getting error, the customer Odata API is a paramterized API and SAP is saying that this is not supported in SAC as it's a tool limitation , any idea how we can consume this and create a story on top of this customer Odata API , or is there any other way to read the data.

I've attached the error and steps.

Regards

Baseer

entry.title: Can we directly access the data stored in SAC when using Import Connection?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,  When we use an  Import Data in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), the imported data gets stored in SAC’s internal database ? , which I understand is based on SAP HANA Cloud.

My question is — since the imported data resides in this internal HANA environment,
is it possible to directly access or query that data (for example, using SAP HANA tools, SQL clients, or external connections)?
Or is this internal storage completely managed and isolated within SAC?

Appreciate any insights or official references on how SAC manages this internal HANA layer and whether external access is technically or administratively possible.

Thanks,
Siva

entry.title: Transporting Deleted Teams from Test to Production in SAP SAC
entry.content:
Dear Team,

As part of our recent housekeeping activity, we identified several unused Teams in  SAP Analytics Cloud  and have deleted them in the Test environment. To maintain consistency across systems, I would like to transport these deletions to the Production environment.

Could anyone please guide me through the steps required to perform this transport? Specifically, I want to ensure that all Teams deleted in Test are also removed in Production following the transport process.

Thank you for your support.

Regards,
Om Pandya

entry.title: SAC date filters
entry.content:
A challenge that we're having is that we'd like to simplify how report consumers can apply date filters in our dashboards.  
We are using an SAC analytic model with acquired data. 
 
What we ideally would like to do:
  1. Give the end user the ability to have a date range filter as a Story filter.  
  2. Have that date filter work for metrics (1) that are logical to count over a date range (easy) and (2) other metrics that only expect a single month (and will crash if they don't receive a single month).  The metric that crashes uses the RESTRICT function to calculate a rolling-12 month count in a numeric point widget. 
  3. We'd like to set the default date filter end date to be the last completed refresh date, which we can access in our Modeler data.  The default date filter start date would then be set to [end date - 24 months]. 
We've accomplished some of the above (point 3) with some page-level scripting and page filters but the holy grail here is a Story filter so users wouldn't need to change a page filter on each page. 
 
Does anyone have some creative thoughts on how to do this? 
 
 Thanks!

entry.title: SAC subtotal challenges
entry.content:
We've run into a couple of challenges with the SUBTOTAL function.

For context, we are using an SAC analytic model.   

  1. We're using the SUBTOTAL function to get percents of totals but there is a 10 dimension limit.  Does anyone  know of an alternative that does not have that limit? 
  2. We've tried to use SUBTOTAL on an aggregated measure (we aggregated it in the Model), but it failed.  Is this expected?  

Thanks for your help!

entry.title: Error while exporting the model in SAC
entry.content:
Hi SAP Folks,

In SAP Analytics Cloud, I encountered one issue while exporting Classic Account Model. It is one time activity. So no export job is required. I created the model using a flat file. Then i needed to export the model as file. 

In the model only 1002 rows are there. Even I filtered out some more columns, so less data should be exported.

But i am getting issue: 
Correlation ID: 3809068113254091b130416369762251

I tried after clearing the google cache and even tried on incognito mode also. But no help!

The SAC version is Advanced trial one.

Kindly help folk! 

Thank you.

entry.title: Question about Capacity Unit Estimation for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning Professional Users
entry.content:
hi, expert 

I am currently using the Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Business Data Cloud (https://bdc-pricing-estimator-sac-sacus10.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/).

I would like to estimate the required capacity units for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning Professional users. According to the estimator, a Planning Standard user requires 72.85 CU per user, whereas a Planning Professional user requires 820.43 CU per user.

Is this correct?
Is the Planning Professional user really that much more expensive?

I would like to use the Professional license for its features, but the budget may not allow it.
What are my options if I need the functionalities of the Professional license but my budget is insufficient?

Thank you in advance for your advice.

entry.title: Error when querying a SAC story that consumes data from an analytical model in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently experiencing issues running SAC stories that consume SAP Datasphere analytical models. This issue has arisen during this summer. We have already created a SAP CASE, but we haven’t received any solution yet . For now, expanding the SAP Datasphere parameters is ruled out due to its extra cost.

We would appreciate any help to unblock this problem. The issue is that the execution time of SAC stories has increased significantly (there hasn’t been any notable increase in data), and in the worst cases, the report execution ends with a timeout (we are aware of the 3-minute limitation).

What concerns us is that the SAC report only displays a table with about 20,000 records. The analytical model consumes a view that is persisted. Furthermore, there are no other processes running in parallel, and the number of SAC executions is minimal.

The error message is:

"code":"inaTimeout","details":{"stack":"See correlation id ada620af-5346-439b-5037-5292cab57589","message":"execution aborted by timeout, Code: 613, SQL State: HY000","code":613,"sqlState":"HY000","name":"HanaError","originalMessage":"execution aborted by timeout"}}

The note related to SAC Timeout is:

0003584795 - Timeout Issue with Analytic Model in SAP Datasphere

Thanks in advance.

Regards,

Miquel

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud session cookies remain after corporate IdP logout
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community!

currently we are facing an issue with our SAP Analytics Cloud, or rather the session management of the product. We created different stories in our SAC which we embedded in our corporate environment so our customers and employees can use them. This is done via iFrame. 

Our SAC has an Cloud Identity Instance as an IdP configured while the Cloud Identity Instance uses a Microsoft based corporate IdP where all SSO requests are forwarded. 

Now for the actual issue: After user A logs initiates a logoff in the corporate environment the session is terminated and the user is forwared to the login page again. But if user B does a login the SAC still has the session cookes from user A active and no further authentication flow is triggered. This means that user B works with the SAC user A until the browser is actually closed (since that is the cookie lifetime) 

We were under the impression that when the corporate IdP terminates the session, the Cloud Identity Service "tells" the Analytics Cloud to delete the session + cookies as well. 

Does anybody have a similar experience with SAC integrations via iFrame?

entry.title: SAC - Problem with Excel Data Model User Access
entry.content:
Hi,

I have created a data model of an uploaded MS Excel file. I granted my colleague Full Controll Access, but he cannot maintain the data model. He cannot Delete Facts and also Set Up the Import Job. Is it possible that only the Owner has Access to this functions?

BR
